definitions.definition: One who, or that which, dries; a desiccative.
definitions.example: The sun and a northwesterly wind are great driers of the earth.

definitions.definition: A household appliance that removes the water from clothing by accelerating evaporation, usually though heat and a tumbling motion.
Any other device or substance, household or industrial, designed to remove water or humidity.
A catalyst used to promote the drying of paints and varnishes by oxidative crosslinking.

definitions.example: This towel's dry. Could you wet it and cover the chicken so it doesn't go dry as it cooks?

definitions.definition: Unable to produce a liquid, as water, oil, or (farming) milk.
definitions.example: This well is as dry as that cow.

definitions.definition: Anhydrous: free from or lacking water in any state, regardless of the presence of other liquids.
Free from or lacking alcohol or alcoholic beverages.
definitions.example: Of course it's a dry house. He was an alcoholic but he's been dry for almost a year now.

definitions.definition: Describing an area where sales of alcoholic or strong alcoholic beverages are banned.
definitions.example: You'll have to drive out of this dry county to find any liquor.

definitions.definition: Free from or lacking embellishment or sweetness, particularly:
(somewhat derogatory) Involving computations rather than work with biological or chemical matter.
(of a sound recording) Free from applied audio effects.
Without a usual complement or consummation; impotent.
definitions.example: never dry fire a bow; dry humping her girlfriend; making a dry run

definitions.definition: Of a mass, service, or rite: involving neither consecration nor communion.
